intro: Canthium cymosum, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features palmate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in cymes. Its structure is characterized by a short stem with multiple branching shoots. Canthium cymosum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to grow in open, sunny environments.
